document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the West Palaearctic species of the genus Pales Robineau­Desvoidy (Diptera: Tachinidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the West Palaearctic species of the genus Pales Robineau­Desvoidy (Diptera: Tachinidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Tachina pumicata
Meigen, 1824
: 397
. Type locality: not given [Europe].

Pales brunicans
Robineau­Desvoidy, 1830
: 156
. Type locality: St. Sauveur [Yonne, France ].
Tachina diniele
Walker, 1849
: 771
. Type locality: England [?].

Zenillia speculanda
Pandellé, 1895
: 338
. Type locality: Hautes­Pyénées [ France ].

Remarks .
P. pumicata
was firstly cited from Sardinia by
Martelli and Arru ( 1958 )
on the basis of specimens reared from
Malacosoma neustria
( Lepidoptera : Lasiocampidae ) and identified by Prof. Filippo Venturi. My examination of these specimens ( FVCP ) revealed that they belong to
P. pavida
. The record of
P. pumicata
from Sardinia by
Richter ( 1995 )
is also based on this misidentification.
